titlestmt.titleproper: Bertha M. B. Taylor genealogical research materials 1894-1932
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Bertha M. B. Taylor genealogical research materials
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Bertha Taylor was the wife of M. Stanton Taylor.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes genealogical research and related materials compiled by Bertha Taylor. Materials include: copies of wills and land agreements; correspondence (some to Taylor at GSP/HSP); notebooks indexing death notices from a newspaper; notes of various names, some Taylor, but many others as well; printed materials such as a map of the British Isles, International Genealogical Directory, and published ship registers for the Port of Philadelphia; newspapers and newspapers clippings; photographs of buildings in Germantown and Philadelphia; and family charts.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
